LDP Extensions for Optimized MAC Address Withdrawal
in a Hierarchical Virtual Private LAN Service (H-VPLS)
Abstract
contents.ja: 抽象

contents.text: RFC 4762 describes a mechanism to remove or unlearn Media Access Control (MAC) addresses that have been dynamically learned in a Virtual Private LAN Service (VPLS) instance for faster convergence on topology changes. The procedure also removes MAC addresses in the VPLS that do not require relearning due to such topology changes. This document defines an enhancement to the MAC address withdraw procedure with an empty MAC list (RFC 4762); this enhancement enables a Provider Edge (PE) device to remove only the MAC addresses that need to be relearned. Additional extensions to RFC 4762 MAC withdraw procedures are specified to provide an optimized MAC flushing for the Provider Backbone Bridging (PBB) VPLS specified in RFC 7041.

1. Introduction
contents.ja: 1.はじめに

contents.text: A method of Virtual Private LAN Service (VPLS), also known as Transparent LAN Services (TLS), is described in [RFC4762]. A VPLS is created using a collection of one or more point-to-point pseudowires (PWs) [RFC4664] configured in a flat, full-mesh topology. The mesh topology provides a LAN segment or broadcast domain that is fully capable of learning and forwarding on Ethernet Media Access Control (MAC) addresses at the Provider Edge (PE) devices.
contents.ja: また、透過LANサービス（TLS）として知られる仮想私設LANサービス（VPLS）の方法は、[RFC4762]に記載されています。 VPLSは、フラット、フルメッシュトポロジで構成された1つのまたは複数のポイントツーポイント疑似回線のコレクション（のPW）[RFC4664]を使用して作成されます。メッシュトポロジは、イーサネットメディアアクセス制御（MAC）プロバイダエッジ（PE）デバイスにおけるアドレスに学習および転送の完全可能なLANセグメントまたはブロードキャストドメインを提供します。

contents.text: This VPLS full-mesh core configuration can be augmented with additional non-meshed spoke nodes to provide a Hierarchical VPLS (H-VPLS) service [RFC4762]. Throughout this document, this configuration is referred to as "regular" H-VPLS.
contents.ja: これは、フルメッシュコア構成が階層VPLS（H-VPLS）サービス[RFC4762]を提供するために追加の非噛合スポークノードと拡張することができるVPLS。本書では、この構成は、「通常の」H-VPLSと呼ばれています。

contents.text: [RFC7041] describes how Provider Backbone Bridging (PBB) can be integrated with VPLS to allow for useful PBB capabilities while continuing to avoid the use of the Multiple Spanning Tree Protocol (MSTP) in the backbone. The combined solution, referred to as "PBB-VPLS", results in better scalability in terms of number of service instances, PWs, and C-MAC (Customer MAC) addresses that need to be handled in the VPLS PEs, depending on the location of the I-component in the PBB-VPLS topology.

contents.text: 3. Overview
contents.ja: 3.概要

contents.text: When the MTU-s switches over to the backup PW, the requirement is to flush the MAC addresses learned in the corresponding Virtual Switch Instance (VSI) in peer PE devices participating in the full mesh, to avoid the black-holing of frames to those addresses. This is accomplished by sending an LDP address withdraw message -- a new message defined in this document -- from the PE that is no longer connected to the MTU-s with the primary PW. The new message contains a list of MAC addresses to be removed and is sent to all other PEs over the corresponding LDP sessions.
contents.ja: MTU-Sは、バックアップPWに切り替わるときに、要求はフルメッシュに参加しているピアPEデバイスに対応する仮想スイッチインスタンス（VSI）で学習したMACアドレスをフラッシュすることで、それらのフレームのブラックホール化を回避するためアドレス。もはや一次PWとMTU-Sに接続されているPEから - 本文書で定義された新しいメッセージ - これは、LDPアドレスがメッセージを撤回送信することによって達成されます。新しいメッセージが削除されると、対応するLDPセッションを介して他のすべてのPEに送信されたMACアドレスのリストが含まれています。

contents.text: In order to minimize the impact on LDP convergence time and scalability when a MAC List TLV contains a large number of MAC addresses, many implementations use an LDP address withdraw message with an empty MAC list. When a PE-rs switch in the full mesh of H-VPLS receives this message, it also flushes MAC addresses that are not affected due to the topology change, thus leading to unnecessary flooding and relearning. Throughout this document, the term "MAC flush message" is used to specify an LDP address withdraw message with an empty MAC list as described in [RFC4762]. The solutions described in this document are applicable only to LDP address withdraw messages with empty MAC lists.
contents.ja: MACリストTLVは、MACアドレスが多数含まれている場合、LDPの収束時間とスケーラビリティへの影響を最小限にするために、多くの実装は、自民党のアドレスが空のMACリストにメッセージを撤回使用しています。 PE-RSはH-VPLSのフルメッシュに切り替えたとき、このメッセージを受信し、それはまた、不要なフラッディングを引き起こすと再学習、によるトポロジー変化に影響されないMACアドレスをフラッシュします。本明細書を通して、用語「MACフラッシュメッセージは、」[RFC4762]に記載されているように、空のMACリストを使用して、メッセージを引き出すLDPアドレスを指定するために使用されます。この文書で説明するソリューションは、唯一の空のMACリストにメッセージを撤回LDPアドレスに適用されます。

contents.text: In a VPLS topology, the core PWs remain active and learning happens on the PE-rs nodes. However, when the VPLS topology changes, the PE-rs must relearn using MAC address withdrawal or flushing. As per the MAC address withdrawal processing rules in [RFC4762], a PE device, on receiving a MAC flush message, removes all MAC addresses associated with the specified VPLS instance (as indicated in the FEC TLV) except the MAC addresses learned over the PW associated with this signaling session over which the message was received. Throughout this document, we use the terminology "positive" MAC flushing or "flush-all-but-mine" for this type of MAC flush message and its actions.

contents.text: 3.1. MAC Flushing on Activation of Backup Spoke PW
contents.ja: 3.1。 MACフラッシングは、バックアップの活性化にPWスポーク

contents.text: This section describes scenarios where MAC flush withdrawal is initiated on activation of a backup PW in H-VPLS.

contents.text: 3.1.1. MAC Flushing Initiated by PE-rs
contents.ja: 3.1.1。 PE-RSによって開始MACフラッシング

contents.text: [RFC4762] specifies that on failure of the primary PW it is PE3-rs (Figure 1) that initiates MAC flushing towards the core. However, note that PE3-rs can initiate MAC flushing only when PE3-rs is dual-homing "aware" -- that is, there is some redundancy management protocol running between the MTU-s and its host PE-rs devices. The scope of this document is applicable to several dual-homing or multi-homing protocols. This document illustrates that multi-homing can be improved with negative MAC flushing. One example is BGP-based multi-homing in LDP-based VPLS, which uses the procedures defined in [VPLS-MH]. In this method of dual-homing, PE3-rs would neither forward any traffic to the MTU-s nor receive any traffic from the MTU-s while PE1-rs is acting as a primary (or designated forwarder).

contents.text: When dual-homing is achieved by manual configuration in the MTU-s, the hosting PE-rs devices are dual-homing "agnostic", and PE3-rs cannot initiate MAC flush messages. PE3-rs can send or receive traffic over the backup PW, since the dual-homing control is with the MTU-s only. When the backup PW is made active by the MTU-s, the MTU-s triggers a MAC flush message. The message is sent over the LDP session associated with the newly activated PW. On receiving the MAC flush message from the MTU-s, PE3-rs (the PE-rs device with a now-active PW) would flush all the MAC addresses it has learned, except the ones learned over the newly activated spoke PW. PE3-rs further initiates a MAC flush message to all other PE devices in the core. Note that a forced switchover to the backup PW can also be invoked by the MTU-s due to maintenance or administrative activities on the former primary spoke PW.

contents.text: The method of MAC flushing initiated by the MTU-s is modeled after Topology Change Notification (TCN) in the Rapid Spanning Tree Protocol (RSTP) [IEEE.802.1Q-2011]. Upon receiving this message, the upstream bridge flushes its entire list of MAC addresses, except the ones received over this link. The upstream bridge then sends the TCN message out of its other ports in that spanning tree instance. The message is further relayed along the spanning tree by the other bridges.

contents.text: MAC flushing on failure, or "negative" MAC flushing, is introduced in this document. The B-VPLS control plane (LDP Signaling) and learning of Backbone MACs (B-MACs) replace the I-component control plane and learning of Customer MACs (C-MACs) throughout the MPLS core. This raises an additional challenge related to black-hole avoidance in the I-component domain as described in this section. Figure 3 describes the case of a Customer Edge (CE) device (node A) dual-homed to two I-component instances located on two PBB-VPLS PEs (PE1-rs and PE2-rs).
contents.ja: PBB-VPLSの展開では、B成分VPLS（B-VPLS）は、1つ以上のI成分インスタンスをサポートするためのインフラストラクチャとして使用されてもよいです。 B-VPLSコントロールプレーン（LDPシグナリング）及びバックボーンMACの学習（B-MACの）MPLSコアを通じてカスタマーのMAC（C-MACの）のI成分制御プレーンと学習を置き換えます。このセクションで説明するように、これはI-コンポーネント領域にブラックホールの回避に関連する追加の挑戦を提起します。図3は、2つのPBB-VPLSのPE（PE1-RSとPE2-RS）にある2つのI成分インスタンスにデュアルホームカスタマエッジ（CE）デバイス（ノードA）の場合について説明します。

contents.text: As the packets flow from C-MAC X to C-MAC Y through PE1-rs with B-MAC B1, the remote PE-rs devices participating in the B-VPLS with the same I-SID (for example, PE3-rs) will learn the C-MAC X associated with B-MAC B1 on PE1-rs. Under a failure condition of the link between CE-A and PE1-rs and on activation of the link to PE2-rs, the remote PE-rs devices (for example, PE3-rs) will forward the traffic destined for C-MAC X to B-MAC B1, resulting in PE1-rs black-holing that traffic until the aging timer expires or a packet flows from X to Y through PE2-rs (B-MAC B2). This may take a long time (the default aging timer is 5 minutes) and may affect a large number of flows across multiple I-components.
contents.ja: パケットは、B-MAC B1、同じI-SID（例えば、PE3-RS）とB-VPLSに関与するリモートPE-RSデバイスとPE1-RSを介してC-MAC YにC-MAC Xから流れるようにPE1-RS上のB-MACのB1に関連付けられているC-MAC Xを学習します。 PE2-RSにCE-AとPE1-RS間リンクの活性化にリンクの故障状態の下で、リモートPE-RSのデバイス（例えば、PE3-RS）はC-MAC X宛のトラフィックを転送しますB-MAC B1に、エージングタイマーが満了するか、パケットがPE2-RS（B-MACのB2）を介してXからYに流れるまで、黒穴形成トラフィックそのPE1-RSが得られます。これは長い時間がかかることがあります（エージングタイマーのデフォルトは5分）と、複数のI-コンポーネント間のフローの多数に影響を与える可能性があります。

contents.text: A possible solution to this issue is to use the existing LDP MAC flushing method as specified in [RFC4762] to flush the B-MAC associated with the PE-rs in the B-VPLS domain where the failure occurred. This will automatically flush the C-MAC-to-B-MAC association in the remote PE-rs devices. This solution has the disadvantage of producing a lot of unnecessary MAC flushing in the B-VPLS domain as there was no failure or topology change affecting the Backbone domain.
contents.ja: この問題の可能な解決策は、[RFC4762]で指定されるように、障害が発生したB-VPLSドメイン内のPE-RSに関連付けられたB-MACをフラッシュするために、既存のLDP MACフラッシング方法を使用することです。これは、自動的にリモートPE-RSデバイスにおけるC-MAC対B-MACの会合をフラッシュします。このソリューションは、バックボーンのドメインに影響を与えるいかなる障害やトポロジー変更がなかったとしてB-VPLSドメイン内の不要なMACのフラッシュの多くを生産するという欠点があります。

contents.text: A better solution -- one that would propagate the I-component events through the backbone infrastructure (B-VPLS) -- is required in order to flush only the C-MAC-to-B-MAC associations in the remote PBB-VPLS-capable PE-rs devices. Since there are no I-component control-plane exchanges across the PBB backbone, extensions to the B-VPLS control plane are required to propagate the I-component MAC flushing events across the B-VPLS.
contents.ja: よりよい解決策 - バックボーンインフラストラクチャ（B-VPLS）を介してI成分イベントを伝播することになる一方は - リモートPBB-VPLS-のみC-MAC対B-MACアソシエーションをフラッシュするために必要とされます可能なPE-RSデバイス。 PBBバックボーンまたがってI-コンポーネントコントロールプレーンの交換がないため、B-VPLS制御プレーンへの拡張は、B-VPLSを横切るI成分MACフラッシングイベントを伝播するために必要とされます。

contents.text: 5.1.4. Optimized MAC Flush Procedures
contents.ja: 5.1.4。最適化されたMACのフラッシュ手順

contents.text: This section expands on the optimized MAC flush procedure in the scenario shown in Figure 2.
contents.ja: このセクションでは、図2に示されたシナリオにおいて最適化されたMACフラッシュ手順を拡張します。

contents.text: When optimized MAC flushing is being used, a PE-rs that is dual-homing aware SHOULD send MAC address messages with a MAC Flush TLV and N = 1, provided the other PEs understand the new messages. Upon receipt of the MAC flush message, PE2-rs identifies the VPLS instance that requires MAC flushing from the FEC element in the FEC TLV. On receiving N = 1, PE2-rs removes all MAC addresses learned from that PW over which the message is received. The same action is performed by PE3-rs and PE4-rs.
contents.ja: 最適化されたMACフラッシングが使用されている場合、デュアルホーミング認識しているPE-RSはMACフラッシュTLVとMACアドレスメッセージを送信すべきであり、N = 1、他のPEが新しいメッセージを理解しました。 MACフラッシュメッセージを受信すると、PE2-RSは、FEC TLVにおけるFEC要素からMACフラッシングが必要VPLSインスタンスを識別する。受信N = 1に、PE2-RSは、メッセージを受信した上、そのPWから学習したすべてのMACアドレスを削除します。同じアクションは、PE3-RSとPE4-RSによって行われます。

contents.text: Figure 4 shows another redundant H-VPLS topology to protect against failure of the MTU-s device. contents.text: 5.2.1. MAC Flush TLV Processing Rules for PBB-VPLS

contents.text: The following steps describe the details of the processing rules for the MAC Flush TLV in the context of PBB-VPLS. In general, these procedures are similar to the VPLS case but are tailored to PBB, which may have a large number of MAC addresses. In PBB, there are two sets of MAC addresses: Backbone (outer) MACs (B-MACs) and Customer (inner) MACs (C-MACs). C-MACs are associated to remote B-MACs by learning. There are also I-SIDs in PBB; I-SIDs are similar to VLANs for the purposes of the discussion in this section. In order to achieve behavior that is similar to the Regular VPLS case, there are some differences in the interpretation of the optimized MAC flush message.
contents.ja: 次の手順は、PBB-VPLSの文脈でMACフラッシュTLVの処理ルールの詳細を記載しています。 MACアドレスの数が多い可能性がある、一般的に、これらの手順は、VPLSの場合と同様であるが、PBBに合わせて調整されています。バックボーン（外側）のMAC（B-MACの）と顧客（内側）のMAC（C-MACの）：PBBでは、2つのMACアドレスのセットが存在します。 C-MACは学習により遠隔B-MACのに関連しています。 I-SIDはPBBでもあります。 I-SIDは、このセクションでの議論の目的のためのVLANに似ています。通常のVPLSの場合と同様である動作を実現するためには、最適化されたMACフラッシュメッセージの解釈に多少の違いがあります。

contents.text: 1. Positive flush of C-MACs. This is equivalent to [RFC4762] MAC flushing in a PBB context. In this case, the N-bit is set to 0; the C-bit is set to 1, and C-MACs are to be flushed. However, since C-MACs are related to B-MACs in an I-SID context, further refinement of the flushing scope is possible.

contents.text: - If an I-SID needs to be flushed (all C-MACs within that I-SID), then I-SIDs are listed in the appropriate TLV. If all I-SIDs are to have the C-MACs flushed, then the I-SID TLV can be empty. It is typical to flush a single I-SID only, since each I-SID is associated with one or more interfaces (typically one, in the case of dual-homing). In the PBB case, flushing the I-SID is equivalent to the empty MAC list discussed in [RFC4762].

This can be the case if an I-SID component has more than one interface and a B-MAC is used to refine the granularity. Since this is a positive MAC flush message, the intended behavior is to flush all C-MACs except those that are associated with B-MACs in the list.

contents.text: 5.2.2. Applicability of the MAC Flush Parameters TLV

contents.text: If the MAC Flush Parameters TLV is received by a Backbone Edge Bridge (BEB) in a PBB-VPLS that does not understand the TLV, then an undesirable MAC flushing action may result. contents.text: 6. Operational Considerations
contents.ja: 6.運用の考慮事項

contents.text: As mentioned earlier, if the MAC Flush Parameters TLV is not understood by a receiver, then an undesirable MAC flushing action would result. To avoid this, one possible solution is to develop an LDP-based capability negotiation mechanism to negotiate support of various MAC flushing capabilities between PE-rs devices in a VPLS instance. A negotiation mechanism was discussed previously and was considered outside the scope of this document. Negotiation is not required to deploy this optimized MAC flushing as described in this document.

contents.text: VPLS may be used with or without the optimization. If an operator wants the optimization for VPLS, it is the operator's responsibility to make sure that the VPLS devices that are capable of supporting the optimization are properly configured. From an operational standpoint, it is RECOMMENDED that implementations of the solution provide administrative control to select the desired MAC flushing action towards a PE-rs device in the VPLS. Thus, in the topology described in Figure 2, an implementation could support PE1-rs, sending optimized MAC flush messages towards the PE-rs devices that support the solution and the PE2-rs device initiating the [RFC4762] style of MAC flush messages towards the PE-rs devices that do not support the optimized solution during upgrades. The PE-rs that supports the MAC Flush Parameters TLV MUST support the RFC 4762 MAC flushing procedures, since this document only augments them.

contents.text: In the case of PBB-VPLS, this operation is the only method supported for specifying I-SIDs, and the optimization is assumed to be supported or should be turned off, reverting to flushing using [RFC4762] at the Backbone MAC level.

contents.text: 8. Security Considerations
contents.ja: 8.セキュリティの考慮事項

contents.text: Control-plane aspects:
contents.ja: コントロールプレーンの側面：

contents.text: LDP security (authentication) methods as described in [RFC5036] are applicable here. Further, this document implements security considerations as discussed in [RFC4447] and [RFC4762]. The extensions defined here optimize the MAC flushing action, and so the risk of security attacks is reduced. However, in the event that the configuration of support for the new TLV can be spoofed, sub-optimal behavior will be seen.
contents.ja: LDPセキュリティ（認証）[RFC5036]に記載されるような方法は、ここで適用可能です。 [RFC4447]及び[RFC4762]で議論するように、さらに、この文書は、セキュリティ上の考慮事項を実現します。ここで定義された拡張は、MACフラッシング動作を最適化し、そのセキュリティ攻撃のリスクが低減されます。しかし、新しいTLVのサポートの設定がスプーフィングすることができた場合に、サブ最適な動作が見られます。

contents.text: Data-plane aspects:
contents.ja: データプレーンの側面：

contents.text: This specification does not have any impact on the VPLS forwarding plane but can improve MAC flushing behavior.
contents.ja: この仕様は、VPLSのフォワーディングプレーンに与える影響はありませんが、MACフラッシュ動作を向上させることができます。
